channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: The children were on an educational cruise of the Caribbean when the pandemic forced them to radically change their plans for returning home in March.
item.title: Dutch students complete Atlantic crossing forced by virus

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE updates: Australia embraces COVIDSafe app as global COVID-19 cases exceed 3 million

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Global COVID-19 cases exceed 3 million as Australia embraces COVIDSafe app, nation's death toll stands at 83

item.description: The trial will involve groups of healthcare workers and patients wearing nicotine patches and other groups wearing placebo patches.
item.title: French scientists to test theory that nicotine combats COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: Health officials worry a coronavirus-related syndrome or some other unidentified infectious pathogen is emerging in children in the UK.
item.title: 'Very worried': Britain issues alert as possible new coronavirus syndrome emerges in children

item.description: The WikiLeaks founder's US extradition case will be delayed over concerns about his ability to attend hearings in person amid the UK's coronavirus lockdown.
item.title: Assange's case may be delayed until November amid coronavirus lockdown

item.description: Streets will be closed to vehicle traffic and temporary bike lanes created to offer New Yorkers more space to stay apart outside during the lockdown.
item.title: New York City aims to open 160km of streets to pedestrians during pandemic

item.description: The study, published in the journal Nature Research, buttresses the notion that the virus can spread through tiny airborne particles known as aerosols.
item.title: Coronavirus lingers in air of crowded spaces, new study finds

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Researchers have discovered 33 more regions of the genome that raises the risk of getting melanoma, giving greater insight into the causes of the deadly cancer.
item.title: Research doubles understanding of what causes melanoma

item.dc:creator: Max Koslowski
item.description: The Q+A episode featured some of the tensest sparring yet over the reopening of schools during the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: Fears Australiaâ€™s 'clever country' label could be lost for generations

item.dc:creator: Melissa Cunningham
item.description: Infectious disease experts say it is safe to reopen schools as Chief Health Officer Brett Sutton appeared to soften his stance against keeping them closed until the end of term two.
item.title: 'Evidence says it is safe to reopen schools'

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Tuesday, April 28

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: The government's plans to spur the post-coronavirus economy with gas-fired power has been challenged as uneconomical and environmentally destructive
item.title: Government's gas-led economic recovery plans questioned

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, April 28, 2020

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Harriet Veitch
item.description: Yes, I know it looks a bit silly. I certainly feel silly, as well as rather like a bank robber.
item.title: I'm wearing a mask for you

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: Researchers from universities around the country are collecting data about the most critically ill coronavirus patients in a bid to improve their treatment.
item.title: Without a vaccine, experts turn to data to help treat COVID-19 patients

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Jackie Trad won South Brisbane with just 500 more first preference votes than Amy McMahon and retained the seat on the back of LNP preferences.
item.title: Amy McMahon set to take on Jackie Trad again in South Brisbane

item.dc:creator: Nick Miller
item.description: Can you fall in love with contemporary art over the internet? A new initiative hopes you can - and that collectors will open their wallets.
item.title: Free 'virtual viewing rooms' in redrawn Melbourne Art Fair

item.dc:creator: Peter Hartcher
item.description: Ambassador Cheng Jingye's threats of a trade boycott provide a moment of clarity for Australia.
item.title: China's man in Canberra has unmasked the regime's true face

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: Bioenergy is being investigated as a potential fuel for the Morrison government's emissions reduction strategy.
item.title: Bioenergy push for emissions reduction and regional growth

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Managing the "waking-up" is as important as managing the "going-to-sleep", Ai Group chief executive Innes Willox says.
item.title: Business calls on national cabinet to smooth over state splits

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: The Berejiklian government has been urged by department officials to embark on a $500 million property buying spree to stimulate the economy.
item.title: NSW government may buy up spare housing in $500 million stimulus plan

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the week ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Tuesday, April 28

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: Australia's largest oil and gas producer, Woodside, is headed for a clash with investors over demands to slash greenhouse gas emissions.
item.title: Climate revolt looms for Woodside on gas emissions goals

item.dc:creator: Stan Grant
item.description: It is hard to be Australian in weeks like this, when Australia remembers its glorious Captain Cook.
item.title: Between the ship and the shore: The Captain James Cook I know

item.description: The government says we should all download the COVIDSafe app, yet there is no rush to legislate for privacy protections.
item.title: Parliament needs to legislate virus app safeguards quickly

item.dc:creator: Jewel Topsfield
item.description: Public housing residents are pushing for an ombudsman of their own, saying their concerns around maintenance, security and drugs are falling through the cracks.
item.title: 'Issues not addressed': Push for public housing ombudsman

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: Scott Morrison wants a "very pro-growth" policy agenda. What did the government have in place before this pandemic?
item.title: A 'very pro-growth' agenda will be tricky to sell

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: Hardy volunteers step in to give native wildlife a fighting chance after bushfires devastated their previously idyllic forests.
item.title: Volunteer food drops help give bushfire-hit wildlife a fighting chance

item.description: Julius Sumner Miller was a "professional sage and entertainer", known to millions of schoolchildren for his physics experiments. But away from the TV cameras, our reporter discovered a philosopher - by turns angry, histrionic and sombre.
item.title: From the Archives, 1980: The demonstrative Professor Miller

item.dc:creator: Stephanie Bull
item.description: Bi-centenary celebrations, Captain Cookâ€™s cutlery, and Tony Curtis pleads guilty
item.title: In the Herald: April 28, 1970

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: One young Sydney man says he is on the verge of homelessness after losing his job at an airline.
item.title: 'Discriminated against': Disability pensioners fight for COVID-19 supplement

item.dc:creator: Sophie Aubrey
item.description: Do your conversations always seem to regress back to COVID-19? We spoke to some experts for ideas for how to spice back up our chats.
item.title: How to have better conversations during COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: Cricket Australia is expected to resist any moves by its troubled TV partners to secure markdowns on their next payments under the $1.18 billion broadcast deal.
item.title: Broadcasters on brink but Cricket Australia digs in on TV rights

item.dc:creator: Kylar Loussikian
item.description: Virgin Australia's administrator will hold the first meeting of creditors on Thursday. And on the airline's share register? Some names from the past still hang around.
item.title: Virgin shareholders join the back of the queue

item.dc:creator: Jenny Noyes
item.description: Veterinary science experts will train at least 160 workers across 11 countries in the increasingly vital task of identifying new diseases that appear in animals.
item.title: Australia to train vet 'detectives' to stop future pandemics in the Asia-Pacific

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: American airline investor Indigo Partners approached three of Virgin Australia's major shareholders about buying a controlling stake in the airline 18 months ago, in a sign it is a serious bidder for the now-collapsed company.
item.title: Virgin suitor Indigo Partners made play for airline 18 months ago

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: When invited by politicians to download an app designed by government to gather personal information only Twitter cranks and contrarians have publicly demurred.
item.title: Meek in a crisis: Rush to download reveals true Australian character

item.dc:creator: Tim Biggs
item.description: Apple iPhone users are still unclear whether the COVIDSafe app will keep working when their phones are locked or other apps are in use.
item.title: Mixed messages on COVIDSafe for iPhone users

item.description: Five weeks into lockdown, it has become clear that COVID-19 presents a clear threat to the gains made in the hard, 5000-year battle that women still have not decisively won.
item.title: Lockdown is threatening hard-won gains for women

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: The Treasurer will use the day he was due to deliver the federal budget to explain how efforts to control the coronavirus have punched huge holes in the nation's economy and finances.
item.title: Frydenberg to update nation on coronavirus damage to economy, budget

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: A threat from China's ambassador of an Australian boycott could cost billions in lost trade in agriculture, tourism and higher education.
item.title: Australia could lose billions from Chinese government boycott threat

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: As the day unfolded: COVIDSafe app goes live as global COVID-19 cases near 3 million, Australian death toll stands at 83

item.description: Melbourne Rebels coach Dave Wessels says his Super Rugby team are hanging out for a play date and will need three weeks training once they get the green light.
item.title: Rebels need three weeks of team training 'minimum' before re-start: Wessels

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: The funding is on its way to more than 100 zoos, wildlife parks and aquariums that are struggling after closing their doors to visitors last month due to coronavirus restrictions.
item.title: $95m rescue package for locked-down zoos, aquariums

item.description: Such are the benefits of loafing on the Central Coast.
item.title: Dunkirk bread makes for a superior retreat

item.title: Coronavirus live updates: One new COVID-19 case in Victoria as state embarks on major testing blitz

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: Possible changes to feeder competition may mean fewer players disrupted in year 12.
item.title: AFL looks to bring back under 19s

item.dc:creator: Tim Barlass
item.description: Captain Cook is part of the nation's psyche, but is his reputation earned or merely enhanced over time?
item.title: Captain Cook, 'the Bradman of sailors', put himself on the map
